PCI.ENDPOS: Nolan Professorship for Excellence in Undergraduate Instruction
PCI.BIO:
Carl Ackermann teaches financial management and personal finance to University of Notre Dame undergraduates. He crusades against excessive fees in the investment industry, redirecting them to fight poverty and despair.

At Notre Dame, Ackermann has had the good fortune of receiving several awards for his teaching and service. He received the James Dincolo Outstanding Teacher Award in 2013, the Senior Class Fellow Award in 2003 and 2011, the BP Outstanding Teacher Award in 2001 and 2009, the Joyce Award for Excellence in Undergraduate Teaching in 2009, the inaugural Dockweiler Award for Excellence in Undergraduate Advising in 2007, and the Kaneb Teaching Award in 2006. In 2012, Businessweek named him one of the ten favorite business professors nationwide.

Ackermann is active in several University service projects and mentoring programs, and participates in Football and Basketball recruiting. He is also a Fellow of the Center for Social Concerns. He holds an A.B. from Amherst College, and a Ph.D. from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.

SERVICE_PUBLIC.ORG: Advisory Board Member, Kids Unlimited (Holland, OH)

Provide comprehensive financial planning for approximately 250 of my former students. All told in my personal finance activities, I now interact with over 1000 members of the Notre Dame community per year. I give them simple, proven strategies (such as choosing low expense ratio, low turnover and no entry/exit fee mutual funds) that should substantially increase their retirement wealth
